result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Jay Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge by the end of supervision. Cash bond on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  
Court waived nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. If revoked Court orderd that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Court set restitution at $0.00.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Jay Wright

records.addlTxt: Defendant failed to appear/report at the House of Correction. Court authorized a commitment for the defendant.

Failure to Report Commitment Referral
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Shelton, Br 40, for review. td
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent

Defendant Derek Jay Wright in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Derek Jay Wright in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea Hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Case passed for State to comply with victim notification as to sentencing. 
...
Case recalled, same appearance. 
Plea hearing proceeded.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 138 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence. The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR. 

AS TO COUNT 3: 
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence. The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR. 


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED: 
- AS TO COUNT 1: 90 DAYS condition time (with Huber release for work and treatment), STAYED until 7-1-2022. Court will permanently STAY condition time if defendant is working minimum 40 hours per week and enrolled in AODA treatment by 7-1-2022.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 50 hours of community service. 
- Complete Thinking For Change Program. 

Court set restitution at $0.00.  Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge by the end of supervision. Cash bond on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Derek Jay Wright not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. State complied with victim notification. Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek Jay Wright in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Derek Jay Wright in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Daniel Fry - MPD.  Court took judicial notice of defendant's pending matter regarding case #21CF5112. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Bail/bond hearing to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Derek Jay Wright not in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Derek Jay Wright in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Derek Jay Wright in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek Jay Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
